oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: The New Digital Bleek and Lloyd Archive
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: ||kabbo (Jantje) (II)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The monster ||khwai-hemm's speech and |kaggen's (the Mantis's) reply, in which |kaggen speaks of the monster devouring |kaggen's things and the Porcupine's things, without waiting for the food that |kaggen will give him. 1) See also The Mantis takes away the Tick's sheep (including Porcupine's speech concerning the coming of ||khwai-hemm), 2) This story is found in Book II-34.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The monster ||khwai-hemms speech to the Mantis and the Mantis's reply
